Plus, the film has a great cast of characters and a gripping plot.

Alternatively, if you're looking for something a bit more light-hearted with a strong focus on character development, "The Seduction of Joe Tynan" (N/A) might be up your alley. You'll get to see Melvyn Douglas and Alan Alda shine as they navigate the complexities of politics and personal relationships in this thought-provoking drama.

I think you'd really enjoy "The Imitation Game"! It's a fascinating true story about Alan Turing, a brilliant mathematician who helped crack the German Enigma code during WWII. With Benedict Cumberbatch starring as Turing, it's a gripping and emotional ride that will keep you invested in his journey.

Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something more action-packed, "Flags of Our Fathers" is a great choice! It's an epic tale of six men who raised the flag at Iwo Jima, and the film features an all-star cast, including Ryan Phillippe and Jamie Bell.
